intro: Nama micrantha, commonly known as the small-flowered nama, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers and opposite, ovate leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Nama micrantha is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to humid, temperate climates.
